title: Sound not working if firefox is already open when I turn on my headphones.
content:
I don't wear my headphones all the time. So if I'm in a forum or facebook, click on a video someone posted or have a few tabs open and want to watch something on youtube, I turn on my headphones and click the link to play it. I don't get any sound. If I open the audio mixer, it doesn't show firefox as one of the apps. If I close firefox, leave the headphones on and connected, then start firefox back up, sound works fine.

I don't believe it did this until I upgraded to 75.

Firefox 76.0.1 Windows 10 Home v1909 OS Build 18363.836

I was hoping it was just a bug that would get fixed with updates, but I'm a full version past when the issue started, so either it's specific to my machine, or it just hasn't been fixed yet.

title: Downloaded files now have write permissions set for group and other on Mac OSX
content:
This is a new development. Happening on all of my Mac OSX machines. Whenever I download a file from Firefox, the downloaded file now has write permissions set for group and other:

-rw-rw-rw-

instead of the more reasonable read-only permissions for group and other:

-rw-r--r--

This is a new development: all of my downloads started displaying these fully writable permissions about a month ago. Happening on multiple computers, so this is tied to Firefox v77.
creator: tim.robishaw

title: Sometimes when closing firefox, something has opened a new browser session, and I close it, i lose all my tabs from the first session, how do i recover them?
content:
Sometimes when closing Firefox, something has opened a new browser session that i didn't know about, and I close it too, and since it only has one tab open, it becomes the save session with only that open tab, thus i lose all my tabs from the first session, how do i recover all my tabs them from the first session? Sometimes, if Firefox has crashed, it asks if you want to recover your previous tabs, but only if it crashed! I would like an option to force that same recovery when you open Firefox and all your previous tabs are gone and replaced by one stupid tab you really didn't even want in the first place and not have to find every previous tab one at a time. If there was a recent history of sessions or at least the previous 2 sessions we could recover all the lost tabs from that first session! This has happened many, many times to me and if very frustrating to loose all my open tabs and have to start opening all my old tabs that i use all the time!

Fixyourlan

creator: varices

title: unable to fully clear cache, stop automatic updates, privacy settings do not work, popups are not being blocked
content: After my Firefox took a 'ninja update' I was not able to keep the cache clear and even though it was set to clear my cache on exit when i would open a fresh instance of firefox it would have items in the cache. nothing I would do would correct this even completely removing Firefox, the profiles, and reinstalling it. Reinstalling it is turning out to be my biggest mistake. Instead of the version 63 installing, which is what my installer was for the installer is only installing the most recent buggy version My version 63 had updates turned off, it should not have taken an update but it did even though the updates were turned off FOR security. I even had the registry set to block from HKLM When I am 'browsing' the internet I am logged into my machine with a user account that can't even make any changes. The current version (76.0.1) is having the same problems that plagued me before after this 'ninja update', the cache will not fully clear. When I open firefox it is showing it has items cached. There should be NOTHING in the cache when it opens, I do not have a home page set, there are no links set to open at startup and no connections should be made. The popup blocker is not only not blocking any popups it is opening them in new windows The machine does not have a virus or malware. Why is firefox so insecure now? The whole idea of using firefox was to be using a secure browser and just a browser it is not supposed to be integrated into the operating system it is not supposed to be interacting with the operating system it is supposed to be an internet browser. Without the ability to prevent this automatic communication and block unwanted traffic from it we may as well be using Internet Explorer, Edge or Chrome. How do we install one of the older more secure versions of Firefox without it automatically updating at the time of the install? How do we actually block the automatic communication? How do we block popups as the popup blocker does not work at all? (it worked beautifully in version 63) How do we get it to clear the cache at exit and open with the cache at 0?

title: Strange flickering since Windows 10 2004 Update
content:
I'm in the preview build of Win10 2004 and since the update Firefox has a strange flickering effect.

First I need to say I have two monitors. So late at night it happens that I have two videos open on each screen. Be it double Youtube or Twitch and Youtube etc.

My main screen has a refresh rate of 165Hz and is 2560x1440. The second one is 1920x1080 with 60Hz. So far I never had any problems. But now if I switch between the two displays with my mouse, the video on the second screen flickers into the first one for a brief second. Nothing happens if there is only text on the second one.

I know it could very well be an compability issue between 2004 and the latest Firefox Version but maybe somebody that already tested 2004 knows whats up.

When you click on the link for any of these objects, it's supposed to then take you into that account/resource. However, the initial login screen just pops up again and when you re-enter the credentials, it just displays the original home page when I logged into my account. Should be displaying the folder list and such of the account/resource I'm proxying into immediately when clicking it in the list from the first pop up window.

Works fine on same computer in Chrome and Edge. Have tested site on 2 other systems (one Windows and one MacOS) and Firefox works fine on both of them. This used to work fine on this PC. Tried uninstalling, rebooting, and then re-installing Firefox, but same thing is happening after refreshing it.

title: Customisable Keyboard Shortcuts
content:
I would really like to be able to Customise Keyboard Shortcuts on firefox. I thought firefox was meant to be customisable and this is such an obvious and simple feature which countless applications provide.

This feature is a necessity for the people who use software with conflicting shortcuts and can even fix issues as fundimental as personal preferance.

One example I can give is: Pressing spacebar when not in an input field scrolls the screen down a viewport. I can see how this might be usefull for some but for the majority of us who don't read long documents online or who prefer to scoll find it an annoying feature especially when hit accidentally. This issue seems trivial, yet there is no simple solution

I really hope this is a priority for mozilla to impliment, particularly due to the simplicity of the component.
